diff_hunk:
@@ -52,6 +52,12 @@
 WINDOWS = sys.platform == 'win32'
 
 
+# TODO: Replace all uses of this function with the literal "0" when the jit
+# is able to support returning numbers (as opposed to only Tensors)
body:
Two things:
1) Yes, the fact that they would be scalar tensors and not Python numbers
2) There is a check somewhere that the result of a function is a tensortype. A python number has type NumberType so it gets caught by this check. I haven't gotten around to seeing what happens if I disable that check yet.
body_html:
Two things:

  1. Yes, the fact that they would be scalar tensors and not Python numbers
  2. There is a check somewhere that the result of a function is a tensortype. A python number has type NumberType so it gets caught by this check. I haven't gotten around to seeing what happens if I disable that check yet.
body_text:
Two things:

Yes, the fact that they would be scalar tensors and not Python numbers
There is a check somewhere that the result of a function is a tensortype. A python number has type NumberType so it gets caught by this check. I haven't gotten around to seeing what happens if I disable that check yet.
